messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Teens in Sacramento, CA
messages.msgSnippet: ... Do you know Ruthann Biel?  Her son is younger, but she probably knows everybody in the unschooling community there.  Do you want me to forward your post to
messages.messageBody:
At 04:48 AM 04/01/2002 +0000, you wrote:
>Greetings - My 14-year-old son and I have recently taken the plunge
>into unschooling, much to the consternation of anyone to whom I
>reveal our decision. There are some people I just won't tell (I tell
>them we're HOME schooling, and they seem better able to handle
>that). Are there any unschooling teens/parents in the Sacramento
>area? I'd love to connect with you for support, ideas, etc. Thanks!
>Carla

Do you know Ruthann Biel? Her son is younger, but she probably knows
everybody in the unschooling community there. Do you want me to forward
your post to her? I think she's away for a few days just now.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling Teens in Sacramento, CA
messages.msgSnippet: + -----Original Message----- + From: researcher77 [mailto:cdcorbett@prodigy.net] + Are there any unschooling teens/parents in the Sacramento + area? Carla,
messages.messageBody:
+ -----Original Message-----
+ From: researcher77 [mailto:cdcorbett@...]

+ Are there any unschooling teens/parents in the Sacramento
+ area?

Carla,

Have you connected up with this org yet? http://www.hsc.org/ I know they
have a large homeschooling conference every year in Sacremento and it's
fairly "unschooly".

Leslie Moyer / Oklahoma

messages.subject: Unschooling Teens in Sacramento, CA
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings - My 14-year-old son and I have recently taken the plunge into unschooling, much to the consternation of anyone to whom I reveal our decision.  There
messages.messageBody:
Greetings - My 14-year-old son and I have recently taken the plunge
into unschooling, much to the consternation of anyone to whom I
reveal our decision. There are some people I just won't tell (I tell
them we're HOME schooling, and they seem better able to handle
that). Are there any unschooling teens/parents in the Sacramento
area? I'd love to connect with you for support, ideas, etc. Thanks!
Carla
